**Item #:**  SCP-███

**Object Class:**  Thaumiel

**Special Containment Procedures:**  The entrance to SCP-███ has been sealed with bricks.  SCP-███ is to be repaired if it becomes so weathered that entry or sight of the interior is possible.  Only Pataphysics Department personnel of Level 3 and above are to know of SCP-███'s existence.

**Description:**  SCP-███ is a large mausoleum located in Site-██'s on-site cemetery.  The building is constructed from severely weathered stone and bears no external distinguishing features.  Its only access point is a rusted iron gate at the center of one wall.  When the object was first discovered, a tarnished brass plaque emblazoned with the words "Department of Abnormalities" was affixed to this gate.

It is not known when SCP-███ was constructed, or by whom.

Beyond the entrance gate, a hallway extends for a long distance before opening into a larger room.  There are numerous small burial chambers along both sides of the hallway, each behind a stone door.  Some of these chambers contain undecorated stone sarcophagi.

Each door is engraved with a name or other moniker that presumably describes the contents of the room behind it or the sarcophagus within.  These labels and the contents of the associated rooms are as follows:

||~ Door Engraving ||~ Contents ||~ Notes ||
|| “The Man of War” || Sarcophagus containing a human skeleton. || The floor of the chamber is littered with shards of severely rusted steel. ||
|| “Hell” || A sinkhole has seemingly opened beneath this chamber. Its horizontal dimensions are approximately those of the burial chamber, but its depth is unknown. || An inscription is visible on the interior wall of the sinkhole several meters down, but it is illegible at that distance and angle. ||
|| [illegible due to damage] || Room is entirely empty. || Area smells faintly of fish. ||
|| “The Devil Machine” || A sarcophagus containing a complex, heavily rusted clockwork device of unknown function. || Rust has rendered all components immobile. ||
|| “Promethean Alloy” || A stack of 120 ingots of an unidentified gray-green metal. || Ingots were heavily tarnished. ||
|| “Lilith” || Sarcophagus containing the remains of an adult human female wearing the standard uniform for humanoid SCP objects.  Bone growths resembling vestigial wings extend from the shoulder blades. || Tongue was removed before death. ||
|| “Jack” || Sarcophagus containing the remains of an adult human male wearing casual clothing.  Individual was castrated before death. || A heart shape surrounding the letter "J" has been carved on the outside of the sarcophagus's lid. ||
|| “PSR B0531+21”[[footnote]]astronomical designation of the Crab Pulsar; significance unknown[[/footnote]] || unknown || Door cannot be opened. ||
|| "Debra Salazar" || Sarcophagus encased in lead. Has not been opened, due to high radiation levels in its vicinity. || The phrase "OUR NAMES AND MEMORIES SHALL NOT BE OBLITERATED" is carved on the back wall. ||
|| "What We Hold Dear" || Sarcophagus stuffed with 45 plush toys of varying size. The toys are shaped like slender black-and-white bipeds with no arms, large eyes, and a single button affixed to the fronts of their bodies. || A 46th toy, which was more brightly colored, differently proportioned, and smaller than the others, was found in a back corner of the room. ||
|| “Epon” || Sarcophagus containing the remains of an adolescent human female.  Length of corpse's hair nearly exceeded its height.  Nude. || A rosary is clutched in one of the corpse's hands. ||
|| “Mr. Brass” || Sarcophagus containing a large assortment of mechanical parts, consisting mostly of brass.  Parts appear to be the components of a humanoid automaton. || Reassembly is impossible due to extensive damage and degradation. ||
|| “Things Lost” || Room is empty. || There is a small hole in the rear wall.  It has been plugged with concrete. ||
|| “Job 10:10”[[footnote]]“Hast thou not poured me out as milk and curdled me like cheese?"[[/footnote]] || Empty sarcophagus. || The crypt door and sarcophagus were both open when discovered. ||
|| "Chaos" || The room is completely filled by a complex, nonfunctional machine of uncertain purpose. || The mangled remains of a person in black and red clothing have been forced into the machinery. ||
|| "Unknown Forgotten Object" || A television set with a shattered screen. Pages from Erich von Däniken's book //Chariots of the Gods?// have been arranged around in the TV in a complex circular pattern. Numerous pins are driven through the papers and connected by an intricate network of colored yarn. || Exploration personnel described the pattern of pages and yarn as resembling a crop circle. ||
|| "No More" || An electrical outlet cover is affixed to the rear wall at eye level, slightly off-center. A broken night light shaped like a stylized shooting star is plugged into it. || There is no power to the outlet; there is only a shallow, empty space behind the cover. ||
|| "Nostalgia" || A large pile of broken musical instruments, torn sheet music, and muddy marching band uniforms. || The words "I remember" have been scratched onto the back wall. Two additional lines of text have been damaged beyond legibility. ||
|| "Mr. Soap" || Sarcophagus containing the waterlogged remains of a human male. || The corpse and the interior of the sarcophagus are coated in a thick layer of soap scum. ||
|| “The Full Man” || Sarcophagus containing the remains of an emaciated man with a greatly distended abdomen. || Forensic examination of the abdomen revealed [DATA LOST] ||
|| "Past" || The tomb is packed with a haphazard assortment of unusual objects, all badly damaged and showing signs of great age. || Examples include WWI-era munitions, 11 small meteorites, a blank flash drive with the number "37" written on it, an organic humanoid automaton, a quadrupedal robot, reels of an unknown silent film, multiple defaced artworks depicting the same unknown man, a //Homo ignotus// skeleton, and an embalmed corpse wearing a Soviet military uniform. ||

The room at the end of the hallway is square, roughly 7 meters on each side.  A large stone tomb stands at the center of the room.  On the top of the tomb, the following has been engraved:

[[=]]
> A memorial for the remembered 
> atop a grave of the [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/system:page-tags/tag/deletion-range |forgotten]]].
[[/=]]

All attempts to access or view the tomb's interior have failed.
